article.title: Ultra-High Energy Neutrino Afterglows of nearby Long Duration Gamma-Ray Bursts

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of model is represented by the lines in Figure 1?
What is the trend of neutrino flux with increasing time in both ISM and wind environments, as shown in Figure 13?
choices: The flux initially increases, then decreases.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the black solid lines represent in Figure 15?
choices: Predicted neutrino fluence from GRB afterglows.
Stacked neutrino fluence from multiple GRBs.
90% upper limit on the integrated stacked fluence in case of no neutrino detection.
Minimum proton energy (Ep,l) in a wind environment.
Maximum proton energy (Ep,s) in a wind environment.
Proton cooling energy (Ep,h) in a wind environment.
Neutrino flux from pion decay in a wind environment.
